recipe.title: Orange Chocolate Cupcake Recipe by Tasty

ingredients.ingredient: 4 oz ; cream cheese, room temperature ; (110 g)
¼ teaspoon ; orange zest, plus more for garnish

steps.step: Cut orange in half. With a paring knife, carefully cut along the entire edge. With a spoon, scoop out the "meat" and set aside in a bowl. Repeat for all oranges. This will yield 6 empty orange halves.
Juice the orange, reserve for the cake mix.
Pre heat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a medium bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, oil and freshly squeezed orange juice. Mix until the batter has no lumps.
Place the orange cups into a muffin tin and fill with ¼ cup (60 g) of the chocolate batter.

In a medium bowl, blend cream cheese, vanilla extract and orange zest until nice and smooth. Add butter and mix on medium high for a couple of minutes. Add powdered sugar and mix until the frosting is uniformly smooth. Put icing into a piping bag.
Let cup cakes cool down. Top the cakes with icing. Sprinkle extra orange zest on top for garnish.

steps_updated.steps_updated: With a paring knife, carefully cut along the entire edge.
With a spoon, scoop out the "meat" and set aside in a bowl.
This will yield 6 empty orange halves.
Juice the orange, reserve for the cake mix.
In a medium bowl, combine cake mix, eggs, oil and freshly squeezed orange juice.
Mix until the batter has no lumps.
Place the orange cups into a muffin tin and fill with ¼ cup (60 g) of the chocolate batter.
In a medium bowl, blend cream cheese, vanilla extract and orange zest until nice and smooth.
Add butter and mix on medium high for a couple of minutes.
Add powdered sugar and mix until the frosting is uniformly smooth.
Put icing into a piping bag.
Sprinkle extra orange zest on top for garnish.
